greeting.title: 你好，我是白喵喵！
greeting.subtitle: 简介
greeting.profile:
你好！我是白喵喵，四川大学基础医学院与法医学院/生物治疗国家重点实验室的三年级硕士研究生。我的专业涉及生物医学、AI4Science等多学科领域。

我的目标是推动人类在医学、计算机科学、数学和物理学方面的知识和能力的边界。我渴望开发创新和智能的解决方案，整合这些领域的原理，以应对复杂的现实挑战。具体来说，我对探索有效高效地利用多模态数据、先进的计算模型和数学框架，以增强科学和医疗领域的理解、决策和问题解决能力感兴趣。我也热衷于发现新的跨学科方法，以推动有意义的进展。

最新动态：我目前正在进行交叉领域（数学/物理/医学/计算机）的研究，积极寻求交流与合作!

timeline.content: 在重庆医科大学本科阶段，主要研究NMDA受体亚基NR3A在抑郁症发病机制中的作用及调控研究。主要参与部分分子生物学实验操作，包括Western Blot、qPCR，以及部分动物行为学实验的实施与数据记录，并参与实验设计讨论和结果分析。作为共同作者参与相关领域研究成果，已发表于《Journal of Affective Disorders》

自2023年6月起，主要围绕结直肠癌干细胞及肝转移相关机制，构建外泌体工程化载体并联合氧化还原破坏与RNA干扰策略，靶向癌症干细胞以增强免疫治疗；同时参与结直肠癌肝转移微环境调控机制研究，通过单细胞测序数据分析CRC外泌体对肝脂质累积及Kupffer细胞介导信号的影响。目前已以第一作者身份向《Journal of Nanobiotechnology》投稿，并以共同作者身份参与发表在《Gut》和《Biomaterials》期刊上的论文。

从2024年7月起，空闲时间主要研究基于机器、深度学习与多组学数据整合的疾病预测与机制探索。主要基于蛋白质序列开展翻译后修饰预测，利用预训练蛋白语言模型（ESM、ProtBert）提取序列特征，并结合CNN/LSTM/Transformer进行修饰位点识别；整合单细胞测序、空间转录组、代谢组及宿主-微生物组数据，构建深度学习预测模型（GNN、Transformer）。目前代码已经初步完成，下一步进行调试与训练。

featuredPublications.authors: Jiangjun Cao, Siyuan Qin, Bowen Li, Zhe Zhang, Peng Miao, Han Yan, Jiufei Duan, Bo He, Kai He, Peilan Peng, Lei Li, Hao Jiang, Zizhuo Xie, Jingwen Jiang, Xia Chen, Hai-Ning Chen, Canhua Huang.
featuredPublications.title: Extracellular vesicle-induced lipid dysregulation drives liver premetastatic niche formation in colorectal cancer
featuredPublications.abstract: Liver metastasis is a leading cause of death in colorectal cancer (CRC). This study reveals that extracellular vesicles (EVs) from highly metastatic CRC cells promote hepatic premetastatic niche (PMN) formation by inducing lipid accumulation in the liver. Lipidomic and single-cell analyses showed that enhanced fatty acid (FA) synthesis in CRC cells increases prosteatogenic lipids in EVs, which are mainly taken up by Kupffer cells, triggering TNF-α secretion and further lipid accumulation. Inhibition of FA synthesis or hepatic lipid accumulation significantly reduced EV-induced metastasis. Patient-derived organoid experiments confirmed that blocking FA synthesis mitigates hepatic lipid deposition and liver metastasis. These findings identify FA synthesis inhibition as a promising strategy to prevent CRC liver metastasis.

featuredPublications.authors: Longqin Wang, Wenting Cheng, Siyuan Qin, Hailong Tian, Guowen Liu, Peng Miao, Canhua Huang, Hao Wang, Jing Jing.
featuredPublications.title: Self-assembly driven nano-salinomycin for high-efficiency cancer immunotherapy by reticulum stress mediated stemness suppression
featuredPublications.abstract: Cancer cells with stemness characteristics effectively escape the recognition and killing of immune-active cells, such as T cells, which has been considered as the root cause of cancer recurrence and metastasis. To sensitize cancer immunotherapy, we have developed salinomycin-repurposed endoplasmic reticulum (ER) stress nanoinducers (DTSS NPs) to synergistically suppress cancer cell stemness. Salinomycin, as a polyether antibiotic demonstrating robust cytotoxicity against tumor stem cell, is co-assembled with thymopentin (TP5) and ER-targeted phototherapeutic agent s-780, and tailored with DSPE-PEG-biotin to obtain DTSS NPs. This nanoplatform not only improves the bioavailability of TP5 and salinomycin, but also ensures controlled drug release and reduces the side effects of therapeutic agents. Moreover, the hyperpyrexia and ROS produced by s-780 further induced ER stress, which downregulates PD-L1 expression and activates the cGAS-STING pathway, while TP5 significantly promotes the proliferation and differentiation of T lymphocytes, resulting in the augment of the anti-tumor immunity. Importantly, salomycin synergistically boosted s-780-mediated ER stress to effectively inhibit the stemness of cancer cells, thereby enhancing the responsiveness of cancer cells to T cells. As expected, DTSS NPs activate systemic immunity and suppress cancer metastasis and recurrence, providing promising solutions for sensitizing cancer immunotherapy by inhibiting cancer cell stemness.

featuredPublications.authors: Mengmeng Zhang, Xiangru Kong, Jing Chen, Wenqin Liu, Can Liu, Xiaoyun Dou, Lin Jiang, Yanmin Luo, Mingrui Song, Peng Miao, Yong Tang, Yun Xiu
featuredPublications.title: Dysfunction of GluN3A subunit is involved in depression-like behaviors through synaptic deficits
featuredPublications.abstract: GluN3A, an inhibitory subunit of N-methyl-d-aspartate receptors (NMDARs), plays an unclear role in depression. In this study, we examined GluN3A expression in a chronic restraint stress (CRS) mouse model of depression and explored its molecular mechanisms. We found that GluN3A expression was significantly reduced in the hippocampus of CRS mice, and restoring GluN3A expression alleviated depression-like behaviors. Furthermore, GluN3A knockout (KO) mice exhibited symptoms of anhedonia and despair, alongside downregulation of genes involved in synapse and axon development. Reduced PSD95 levels in GluN3A KO mice were rescued by viral re-expression of GluN3A, highlighting its crucial role in regulating synaptic function and depression-related behaviors. Despite these findings, the full mechanism by which GluN3A contributes to depression remains unclear.

研究经历.work: 在该课题中，我学习并参与研究NMDA受体抑制性亚基NR3A（GluN3A）在抑郁症发生中的作用。工作内容包括：参与部分动物行为学实验（如糖水偏好实验、强迫游泳实验、开放场实验）的实施与数据记录；开展分子生物学实验（蛋白和 RNA 提取、Western Blot、qPCR 等）用于检测突触相关蛋白（例如 PSD95）与相关基因表达的改变；参与课题讨论，最终以参与作者身份发表在《Journal of Affective Disorders》。通过该项目我系统掌握了动物行为学与分子水平的联动研究方法，并提升了实验设计、数据解析与科研写作能力。

location.name: 四川大学 华西基础医学院与法医学院/生物治疗国家重点实验室

研究经历.work: 我的研究主要围绕结直肠癌干细胞及肝转移机制展开，致力于开发靶向癌症干细胞的免疫治疗策略。具体工作包括构建外泌体工程化载体，并结合氧化还原破坏和RNA干扰方法，以增强免疫治疗效果。同时，我参与结直肠癌肝转移微环境的机制研究，利用单细胞测序分析CRC外泌体对肝脂质累积及Kupffer细胞介导信号的影响。在科研过程中，我独立负责实验设计与执行，包括外泌体修饰、RNA 干扰体系构建、细胞及动物肿瘤模型验证，以及分子检测（Western Blot、qPCR、ELISA 等）以及表型检测（DNA损伤、ROS检测、流式分析等），并主导论文撰写和图表制作。研究成果包括作为第一作者投稿至《Journal of Nanobiotechnology》，以及作为共同作者参与发表于《Gut》和《Biomaterials 的相关研究》。

从 2024 年起，我开始自主探索基于机器学习与深度学习的多组学数据整合，用于疾病预测与机制研究。我整合了单细胞测序、空间转录组、代谢组及宿主-微生物组数据，并构建深度学习预测模型（如 GNN、Transformer）。在蛋白质序列分析方面，我利用预训练蛋白语言模型（ESM、ProtBert）提取序列特征，结合 CNN、LSTM 和 Transformer 进行翻译后修饰位点预测。该项目目前已完成多组学数据预处理和模型框架搭建，下一步将进行模型调试与训练。
